results.title: The Divine Garbo
results.creator_credit: Susan F Walker, Ellen Krass and Turner Pictures
results.brief_description: Garbo - the undefinable mystique. The most elusive, seductive and enigmatic actress the cinema has ever known, this Swedish star attracted audiences like no other. Her intense desire for privacy became legendary, vanishing from the screen - and the public - at the height of her commercial success. Hosted by actress Glenn Close, this video presents an insight to the mysterious Greta Garbo, including clips from such films as “Grand Hotel”, “Queen Christina”, “Anna Karenina”, “Camille” and “Ninotchka”, plus some rare behind-the-scenes glimpses, screen-test footage and foreign film clips - all of which only add to enhance the legend of one of Hollywood’s most elusive screen love goddesses.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Susan F Walker, Ellen Krass and Turner Pictures

results.title: Finland: fresh and original
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Visit unspoilt and unhurried Finland at the crossroads between East and West. Learn about the history of Finland and the Swedish influence on this country. Visit the Baltic port of Helsinki, Jyuaskyla and Finland’s second largest city at Tampere with it famous Lutheran cathedral. Step back in time in Turka with its handicraft museum and visit the Sibelius Museum. Travel north to the unspoilt wilderness of Lapland where the Lapps still tend herds of reindeer. Experience a sauna Finnish style.

results.title: Argentina: land of natural wonder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Geographically, Argentina (which is Spanish for “silver”) is the eighth largest country in the world. This colourful guided tour takes us through the highlights of Argentina’s landscape and history. From chilly Tierra del Fuego, the country’s southern-most region, to Aconcagua, the tallest mountain in the western hemisphere. Much of the program is devoted to the sweeping plains of Patagonia, home of the Argentinian cowboy - the gaucho. The video also introduces us to Argentinian wildlife, the beaches of Mar del Plata, the world’s only growing glacier, Perito Mereno and the sights and nightspots of Buenos Aires.

results.title: 14 Days to Remember
results.creator_credit: Peter Hood, Bob Whittington and I T N
results.brief_description: A compilation of news footage covering historic events of the past thirty years: 1961 - East Germany builds the Berlin Wall; 1963 - U.S. President Kennedy is assassinated; 1968 - Soviet forces invade Czechoslovakia; 1969 - the first man on the moon; 1974 - the U.S. Watergate scandal; 1975 - the fall of Saigon ending the Vietnam War; 1980 - Iranian Embassy Siege; 1981 - the wedding of Britain’s Prince Charles and Lady Diana; 1982 - Britain invades the Falklands and wins back the islands; 1984 - the IRA attempt to blow up the entire British Cabinet meeting at Brighton; 1984 - Bhopal where poison gas leaks kill more than 3,000 Indians; 1986 - the Shuttle Disaster; 1986 - the Russian nuclear reactor at Chernobyl blows; 1988 - the tragedy of the Armenian earthquake.

results.title: Mystical Malaysia
results.creator_credit: Michael Jewell, Christopher Zrike, Video Technics International and International Video Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Your visit to exotic Malaysia begins in the capital, Kuala Lumpur, one of the worlds most fascinating cities. Travel to the famed trading port of Malacca, with its Dutch architecture and gape as worshippers burn paper money in the Temple of Bright Clouds. Journey to Sarawak and ride a native longboat deep into the Borneo jungle.

results.title: Japan: The Island Empire
results.creator_credit: Maureen Zrike, Christopher Zrike and International Video Network
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video visits”.
Japan begins to unfold as you enter a Zen temple, then witness an ancient ritual in a Shinto shrine. In the resort of Ibusuki, you will marvel at guests buried to the neck in steaming volcanic sand. Admire the great Buddha of Kamakura and the splendid architecture of 400 year old Himeji Castle. Then plunge into the frantic pace of Tokyo during the Sanja Matsuri Festival.

results.title: Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: This program presents Alfred Hitchcock, the master of suspense, in a rare discussion of his film-making techniques and his illustrious 50 year career as a director. Filled with classic film clips, the program reveals that Hitchcock’s famous cinematic techniques for instilling suspense and terror were the result of his detailed planning of each scene at the script stage. Hitchcock’s career is reviewed with the use of selected film clips from his most famous movies and through the recollections of the stars who worked with him. Included are excerpts from “Psycho” with Anthony Perkins and Janet Leigh, “North by North West” with Cary Grant, and “Frenzy” with Jon Finch and Barry Foster.

results.title: Men who molest
results.brief_description: This program is an investigation of four men who have exhibited a range of molestation behaviour. Three of them are in treatment at the largest American community-based facility. The documentary examines the therapy that these men undergo in an attempt to control their behaviour and it emphasises the importance of therapy for this complex social problem.

results.title: Search for the super
results.creator_credit: Anne Batty, Peter Batty and Peter Batty Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Visions of War”.
This is the fascinating background story to the making and testing of the first H-Bomb. It contains much fine colour archive film as well as contributions from many of the principal participants in the hydrogen-bomb saga. The story continues on from the first atomic bomb drops on Hiroshima and Nagasaki in 1945, through to the bomb test at Bikini Atoll in 1954.
